resources.string: This app uses the accessibility permission to simulate the manual gestures used to power off the phone. \nThe accessibility permission is required in order to be able to call the power dialog and then simulate the gestures to turn off the phone. If your android version is at least 13, you may have to check the restricted settings section.
This button will open this tab
This button will reset the position of the draggable items to the center of the screen

This button will call the power dialog so that it is possible to check which action should be performed. This button will not power off the phone, it will just call the power dialog. To power off the phone use the timer in the Timer tab.
These draggable elements can be repositioned around the screen to reproduce the gestures (click(s)/swipe) used to power off the phone

On the Settings tab it is possible to select the type of gestures required to turn off the phone. After selecting the type of gesture (one click, a single long press that lasts 5s, two clicks or a swipe) the user has to drag the draggable circles where the click(s) should be simulated. Click the button to watch a short video about how it works.

In case two clicks are selected the app will simulate first the click of circle one and then the click of circle two, with a delay of 2.5 seconds between. In case the swipe is selected, the app will simulate a swipe from point one to point two.

On the Timer tab it is possible to set up a timer to power off the phone. It is first necessary to give the accessibility permission and to set up the settings tab for the app to be able to emulate the power off gesture.\nThe timer is in seconds and the spinner on the right will select how many seconds, the spinner on the center how many minutes, the spinner on the left how many hours the timer will wait before powering off the phone. The last timer manually selected can be restored with the button Last Timer.\nThis app should theoretically work even if the screen is off, but that may vary based on the battery optimization, power saving mode, phone model and so on. It is suggested to leave the phone (even locked) on the timer tab after starting the countdown. The power off gestures could require extra time after the set timer if the time while the screen is totally off is more than 5 minutes.

On the Schedule tab it is possible to schedule up to 10 alarms to power off the phone. It is first necessary to do the same setup required by the timer tab.
It is possible to create new schedules by clicking on the + green button at the bottom of the screen; each schedule can be switched on and off with the switch button and it can be removed with the delete (bin) button. To set the hour when it will shut down the phone you can click on the schedule and a time picker will be shown.
It is possible to set the schedule as a repeating one with the toggle buttons at the bottom of each schedule. If none of them are activate the alarm will only repeat once and then turn itself off, else it will repeat at the set hour every week at the specified day(s).
Please keep in mind that according to the official documentation, setting up schedules can be extremely expensive on battery use.
